remarks: Characterizing properties of the polynomial evaluation map function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Mar-2015.)
statement:
evlsval.q $e |- Q = ( ( I evalSub S ) ` R ) $.
evlsval.w $e |- W = ( I mPoly U ) $.
evlsval.v $e |- V = ( I mVar U ) $.
evlsval.u $e |- U = ( S |`s R ) $.
evlsval.t $e |- T = ( S ^s ( B ^m I ) ) $.
evlsval.b $e |- B = ( Base ` S ) $.
evlsval.a $e |- A = ( algSc ` W ) $.
evlsval.x $e |- X = ( x e. R |-> ( ( B ^m I ) X. { x } ) ) $.
evlsval.y $e |- Y = ( x e. I |-> ( g e. ( B ^m I ) |-> ( g ` x ) ) ) $.
evlsval2 $p |- ( ( I e. _V /\ S e. CRing /\ R e. ( SubRing ` S ) ) -> ( Q e. ( W RingHom T ) /\ ( ( Q o. A ) = X /\ ( Q o. V ) = Y ) ) ) $.
$d B g x $.
$d I g x $.
$d R g x $.
$d S g x $.
$d T x $.
